channel.title: ClassCastException
channel.description:
Okay, I was just wondering a little about this Exception. I'm using bytecode to hijack java.net.Socket so I can monitor what's being read/written via the streams, but I'm having a little trouble. Jagex has a class that handles this, which is currently gd.class or something. The constructor for gd is gd(Socket, aa). So I'm hacking it so that it's gd(SocketHack, aa). Jagex also has an Object spread throughout the classes for whatever reason, and they cast it to a java.net.Socket when initializing gd. I'm changing that checkcast to my SocketHack class as well. SocketHack is a subclass of java.net.Socket, so I'm wondering why I'm getting this exception thrown at me. Fuck, I'll just attach my source.
Help appreciated :)

item.title: ClassCastException
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:10, topic:19528”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=29642.msg341892#msg341892 date=1161601294]
White Castle, I hate to suggest somthing like this, but the easiest way for you to have a look at thier socket connections is to simply replace Sun’s Socket class with one of your own, you can do this the dirty way by replacing the Socket class in rt.jar, or the clean(er) way by overriding that class on the command line. Thats what I would do if I were you.
[/quote]
I dunno how easy it would be…even though its not going to be, if it would turn out to be a bot he’d distribute that would be far too impractical. But for plain testing purposes, that would be fine, yea.[/quote]It is easy to patch the core java classes, even Ibot has done it

Read full topic

Thats what I would do if I were you. ;)[/quote]yea, just patch the java socket class, in your runtime args have -Xbootclasspath/p:“path/to/patch”

item.title: ClassCastException
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Yeah ruler, it will. Jagex uses that one Object for all their IO operations, and they reflect it directly. Another problem is, that the loader doesn’t load the class that initializes the Object to the Socket, so basically I’m fucked.

Bahh, I’ll try again tomorrow. lulz

Read full topic

item.title: ClassCastException
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

Wont reflection screw you if you do this?

Read full topic

item.title: ClassCastException
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

The error is because you’re declaring a class of type Socket, not type SocketHack (or whatever its called).

You’re going by the idea that you can legally do this in java, using java.util.List for example:

List<?> myList = new ArrayList<?>();
// ...
ArrayList<?> myArrayList = (ArrayList<?>)myList;

You can do that because technically myList is of type ArrayList, even though its stored in a superclass type. Unfortunately, you can’t create a class of type ArrayList<?> or something and cast it to some example-nonexisting subclass. This makes it tough for you, i know, since you need to change the initialization of the Socket object to that of a SocketHack…but I can’t think of an alternative really than to change the type during the declaration of that object.

Hmm, started this post a while ago and you beat me to it Galook. Oh well, hopefully an example will help explain it.

[quote=“Galook, post:4, topic:19528”]edit: also, you cannot cast one subclass of a class to another subclass of that same class if the first class is not a subclass of the secondclass[/quote]heh, thats a tongue twister

Read full topic

item.title: ClassCastException
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

You cannot cast a superclass to a subclass, only a subclass to a superclass.

If thats not what u mean, my bad.

edit: also, you cannot cast one subclass of a class to another subclass of that same class if the first class is not a subclass of the secondclass

Read full topic

item.title: ClassCastException
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

[06:03:45] Starting sHack... [06:03:46] Loading from http://se3.runescape.com/loader208553592.jar... Error: client.I(433) client.E(-1001) client.J(17879) pa.V(-75) | client:121 clie nt:888 client:671 pa:331 pa:171 java.lang.Thread.run | java.lang.ClassCastExcept ion: java.net.Socket error_game_crash

One of Jagex’s tailored RuntimeExceptions… meh.

Read full topic
